Justification: Huck fakes his own death, rejecting societal norms.
On the raft with Jim, Huck begins questioning slavery and morality.
He faces moral dilemmas, especially when deciding to help Jim escape.
Huck lies to protect Jim, internalizing his new sense of right and wrong.
He rejects the plan to ‘civilize’ him again, fully choosing his own path.
By the end, Huck is committed to freedom over conformity.
